intro: Conophytum pilosulum, commonly known as the woolly conophytum, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy stems and thick, woolly leaves that help it retain moisture. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Conophytum pilosulum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
